intro: Eutoca menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' eutoca, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Eutoca menziesii is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
